wikitext.*:
'''Razanur Tûk''' was the actual [[Westron]] form of the [[Hobbitish]] name anglicised by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] into "[[Peregrin Took]]".<ref>{{App|F2}}</ref>

In ''[[The Peoples of Middle-earth]]'', Tolkien states that ''Razanur'' was the name of a legendary traveller and comes from ''raza'' "stranger", and ''razan'' "foreign".<ref>{{PM|II}}, p. 50</ref>
